image.altText: A man turns looking at the camera with a neutral expression. Behind him are cell doors. There are passport stamps on the image.

props.synopsis: The work undercover operatives and sources do is a key weapon against organised crime. These men say our law enforcement agencies have abandoned them.

title.children: Miles risked his life gathering intelligence on organised crime syndicates. He says his cover's blown

image.altText: A man and a woman wearing masks and formal clothing pose with clear glass trophies.

props.synopsis: Scientists Katalin Karik√≥ and Drew Weissman have won the 2023 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for discoveries enabling the development of mRNA COVID-19 vaccines.

title.children: Nobel Prize for Physiology or Medicine awarded to scientists whose work enabled mRNA COVID-19 vaccines

image.altText: Rock lookout over bushland

props.synopsis: Emergency services discovered her body beneath the popular scenic spot this afternoon.

title.children: Woman dies after falling 50 metres from popular bush lookout

image.altText: Collage of Asian man with his adopted family, a photo of a Buddhist monk, and the man as a young monk.

props.synopsis: Jin-Gang-Dhyana is a branch of Buddhism with followers around the globe. But one man born into the spiritual community alleges it operates more like a cult, restricting contact with society and enforcing strict rules on the lives of some of its members.

title.children: Richard didn't go to school. He now believes he was raised in a cult

image.altText: A sleek, modern dark-grey submarine faces the camera in silhouette on the surface of the water.

props.synopsis: The AUKUS program will see Australia provided with nuclear-powered attack submarines from the early 2030s onwards to help counter China's ambitions in the Indo-Pacific region.

title.children: BAE Systems awarded $7.6b contract to develop AUKUS submarines

image.altText: The exterior of the Don Dale Youth Detention Centre, showing the building surrounding by a barbed wire fence.

props.synopsis: The then-16-year-old claims¬†he was acting in self-defence against unlawful deprivation after being held under extended lockdowns when he spat in a cup of milk and threw it at youth justice officers.

title.children: Don Dale children's prison accused of unlawful lockdowns during milk-throwing case

image.altText: Firefighters use an extended ladder to reach up to an historic-looking building on fire.

props.synopsis: The Spanish nightclubs are understood to have been operating without a valid permit when 13 people were killed in a fire.

title.children: Spanish city previously ordered closure of nightclubs at centre of fatal fire

image.altText: Felled trees along a road with emergency crews after a a bushfire went through

props.synopsis: An emergency warning is¬†downgraded for a fire burning near the town of Gulgong in NSW's Central West, with authorities warning those remaining in the district to continue monitoring the situation.

title.children: Bushfire threat eases in NSW's Central West as firefighters control flames fanned by 'erratic' winds

props.synopsis: NSW Health Minister Ryan Park says he can't commit to pill testing as a "silver bullet" solution, following¬†the deaths of two men in their 20s who attended the¬†Knockout Outdoor festival in Sydney over the weekend.

title.children: 'Lost for words': Renewed calls for pill testing to be introduced in NSW after two music festival deaths

image.altText: nsw police at a crime scene where a woman was found inside a home in Bankstown

props.synopsis: The 31-year-old man, who is the woman's, 67, son, was tasered by police at the Wattle Street residence in Bankstown and was subsequently arrested.

title.children: Man tasered after allegedly pulling out 'large kitchen knife' as mother found dead at home in south-west Sydney

image.altText: A female cricketer raises her bat in one hand and helmet in the other during a match and smiles

props.synopsis: Australia have fallen victim to the greatest women's Twenty20 run chase of all time.

title.children: West Indies level T20 series against Australia after Hayley Matthews' heroic century

image.altText: a rugby league team celebrate a win

props.synopsis: The Newcastle Yowies and Walgett Aboriginal Connection take home the titles in a nailbiting day of rugby league.

title.children: Extra time thriller and the battle of the west keep Koori Knockout crowd on edge

image.altText: A close up of a small rhinoceros calf standing on sand and with its head close to its approaching mother's.

props.synopsis: Indonesia's government says the¬†rare Sumatran rhinoceros was born last week and stood up 45 minutes after her birth.

title.children: 'Happy news' as endangered Sumatran rhino, the smallest and hairiest species, is born in Indonesia

image.altText: two men in an inflatable boat approach another one without a driver on the sea

props.synopsis: Lifesavers had to evacuate Warrnambool's main beach because a rogue inflatable rescue boat was veering towards surfers and doing tight circles near swimmers after its operator went overboard.

title.children: Footage shows battle to catch runaway rubber duck after lifesaver is 'catapulted' from boat

image.altText: Red clouds from a bushfire above farmland in East Gippsland.

props.synopsis: Crews are working to contain multiple fires in Victoria's east¬†as forecast¬†winds approach, with confirmation at least one house and about 5,000 hectares have burnt in the spring blazes.

title.children: Victorian authorities warn residents to 'prepare and be ready to act' as strong overnight winds expected

image.altText: Three older women sit at a table chatting.

props.synopsis: Skyrocketing rents are pushing many older single women into a type of accommodation that is usually associated with young adults ‚Äî shared housing.

title.children: 'There was just nothing else': Expensive rents forcing older women into shared housing

image.altText: Slinger counter drone system aiming at a drone in the air.

props.synopsis: In the back lot of an industrial site¬†in Canberra, engineers are producing a response to the growing¬†drone threat in Ukraine. It is called Slinger ‚Äî and it is designed to counter drones at a cost that countries like Ukraine can afford.

title.children: Australian 'drone killer' system heading for Ukraine

image.altText: A New Zealand regional rugby union team smile and shout in the dressing room as they spray alcohol near the trophy after a win.

props.synopsis: Hawke's Bay Rugby chief executive Jay Campbell says his team are¬†shattered to have broken the Ranfurly Shield trophy while partying.

title.children: 'We broke the Ranfurly': Beloved NZ rugby trophy trashed during victory celebrations

image.altText: Woman with white hair in green shirt with resigned and upset expression stands in front of highway backdrop

props.synopsis: Four years ago these residents of Sussex Inlet were trapped in their town, cut off by fire. They fear the same thing could happen¬†this summer.

title.children: NSW communities fear Black Summer 'deja vu' as fuel loads increase along key road routes

image.altText: Road closed sign on the side of road with crashed truck and car behind it in the bush

props.synopsis: NT Police are still working to confirm the identities of the people who died, but say four of the six victims are believed to be children.

title.children: Four children believed to be among six people killed in NT fatal crash

image.altText: A small blue and white home sit in a green backyard. it has open white french doors.

props.synopsis: The SA government says "granny flat reform" will add to rental supply, but the opposition is questioning how many extra dwellings will be ready for the market.

title.children: Granny flats the next frontier to tackling the housing crisis in South Australia

image.altText: Mr Biden looks towards Mr Zelenskyy as the pair walk.

props.synopsis: US politicians have stopped Ukraine¬†funding in a bid to avoid a total government shutdown. But what does that mean for Ukraine's war with Russia?¬†

title.children: Could the United States' war fatigue sound the death knell for Ukraine's counterattack?

image.altText: A bearded man in a white lab coat seated in front of a lab fridge. He holds up a glass jar of red seaweed floating in water

props.synopsis: Seaweed, cows and cutting-edge science: This is how Sam Elsom swapped fashion for farming to spearhead a revolutionary climate change solution. But he's facing a major obstacle.

title.children: Why billionaire Michael Bloomberg wants to help Sam Elsom turn his seaweed solution for climate change into a reality

image.altText: An aerial photo of a small, busy town at sunset with a hotel in the foreground and cars parked along the main street.

props.synopsis: Converted airports, refurbished nursing homes, caravans, sheds and school camps aren't considered suitable housing options. But they're all in¬†the mix as workers struggle to find a place to live near their workplace that they can afford.

title.children: This seaside town is so popular that employers are turning an aged care home into accommodation for their staff

image.altText: Three people in yellow and black snow gear in an icy dugout.

props.synopsis: It's one of the most challenging work environments on the planet. But with hundreds of applicants, the process of selecting the best candidate takes eight months and resembles a reality TV contest.

title.children: Reckon you can handle a year in Antarctica as a station leader? This is what it takes to pass the test

image.altText: a house for sale in the brisbane suburb of stafford with the sale sign in the front yard

props.synopsis: Housing data for September shows prices rose 0.8¬†per cent, led by Adelaide, Brisbane and Perth, despite¬†a gradual increase in properties for sale and higher interest rates.

title.children: House prices on track to hit new record high, continuing to frustrate first home buyers

image.altText: Koala wrapped in yellow blanket being held by staff member as another staff member moves to treat it. Onlookers watching on.

props.synopsis: The Port Macquarie¬†Koala Hospital, which¬†began in the garage of its founders and went on to become a leading force in national research and conservation efforts, is celebrating 50 years.

title.children: 5,000 koalas saved: Koala hospital celebrates 50 years of conservation and research

image.altText: A full-body pic of an echidna's side highlights its short hair and 5cm-long spikes. Its short beak digs into vibrant grass

props.synopsis: Some of the most elusive sounds in nature ‚Äî echidnas talking to each other ‚Äî have¬†finally been recorded. Could this be how the spiky creatures flirt¬†during breeding season?

title.children: With a grunt, a coo and a wheeze, echidnas recorded communicating for the first time

image.altText: man in red cap and green shirt pictured with cigarette hanging from his mouth

props.synopsis: Police say a¬†22-year-old man suffered¬†significant facial burns¬†after he was allegedly¬†set on fire by another¬†man attempting to ignite an aerosol can.

title.children: Police seek suspect after man was allegedly set alight at Deniliquin Ute Muster campsite

image.altText: A yellow sign saying 'beach closed', in front of a beach and jetty.

props.synopsis: A woman has serious leg injuries after being attacked by a shark at Beachport in South Australia's south-east, police say.

title.children: Witnesses describe 'horrifying' moments after shark attacked swimmer near SA jetty

image.altText: A student at Yipirinya School wiping his eye.

props.synopsis: For decades, an eye disease known as trachoma was stealing the sight of Indigenous Australians. Now, the disease is on its way to being eradicated.

title.children: How this little-known eye infection is still stealing sight in parts of Australia
